segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Load and unload device drivers security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Load and unload device drivers security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Load and unload device drivers security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Load and unload device drivers security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which users can dynamically load and unload device drivers.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which users can dynamically load and unload device drivers.

segment.source: This user right is not required if a signed driver for the new hardware already exists in the driver.cab file on the device.
segment.target: This user right is not required if a signed driver for the new hardware already exists in the driver.cab file on the device.

segment.source: Device drivers run as highly privileged code.
segment.target: Device drivers run as highly privileged code.

segment.source: Windows supports the Plug and Play specifications that define how a computer can detect and configure newly added hardware, and then automatically install the device driver.
segment.target: Windows supports the Plug and Play specifications that define how a computer can detect and configure newly added hardware, and then automatically install the device driver.

segment.source: Prior to Plug and Play, users needed to manually configure devices before attaching them to the device.
segment.target: Prior to Plug and Play, users needed to manually configure devices before attaching them to the device.

segment.source: This model allows a user to plug in the hardware, then Windows searches for an appropriate device driver package and automatically configures it to work without interfering with other devices.
segment.target: This model allows a user to plug in the hardware, then Windows searches for an appropriate device driver package and automatically configures it to work without interfering with other devices.

segment.source: Because device driver software runs as if it is a part of the operating system with unrestricted access to the entire computer, it is critical that only known and authorized device drivers be permitted.
segment.target: Because device driver software runs as if it is a part of the operating system with unrestricted access to the entire computer, it is critical that only known and authorized device drivers be permitted.

segment.source: Because of the potential security risk, do not assign this user right to any user, group, or process that you do not want to take over the system.
segment.target: Because of the potential security risk, do not assign this user right to any user, group, or process that you do not want to take over the system.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: By default this setting is Administrators and Print Operators on domain controllers and Administrators on stand-alone servers.
segment.target: By default this setting is Administrators and Print Operators on domain controllers and Administrators on stand-alone servers.

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Device drivers run as highly privileged code.
segment.target: Device drivers run as highly privileged code.

segment.source: A user who has the Load and unload device drivers user right could unintentionally install malware that masquerades as a device driver.
segment.target: A user who has the Load and unload device drivers user right could unintentionally install malware that masquerades as a device driver.

segment.source: Administrators should exercise care and install only drivers with verified digital signatures.
segment.target: Administrators should exercise care and install only drivers with verified digital signatures.

segment.source: Note: You must have this user right or be a member of the local Administrators group to install a new driver for a local printer or to manage a local printer and configure defaults for options such as duplex printing.
segment.target: Note: You must have this user right or be a member of the local Administrators group to install a new driver for a local printer or to manage a local printer and configure defaults for options such as duplex printing.

segment.source: Do not assign the Load and unload device drivers user right to any user or group other than Administrators on member servers.
segment.target: Do not assign the Load and unload device drivers user right to any user or group other than Administrators on member servers.

segment.source: On domain controllers, do not assign this user right to any user or group other than Domain Admins.
segment.target: On domain controllers, do not assign this user right to any user or group other than Domain Admins.

segment.source: If you remove the Load and unload device drivers user right from the Print Operators group or other accounts, you could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.
segment.target: If you remove the Load and unload device drivers user right from the Print Operators group or other accounts, you could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.

segment.source: You should ensure that delegated tasks are not negatively affected.
segment.target: You should ensure that delegated tasks are not negatively affected.
